item.title: Road & pavement obstruction, 3rd August
item.description:
This vehicle in the photograph has been here for a week with oil and other substances spilling out onto the pavement on the road and the drain. I don’t know what it is but it’s preventing residence from parking on the residence side of the street and also causing a danger to pedestrians Wanting to cross the road due to the mess that is coming out of the vehicle and in the curb

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aynscombe Angle, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping on this junction, 3rd August
item.description:
Please remove promptly ! Add signs to prevent further flytipping as this is a popular spot for this kind of behaviour! Thanx

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colegrove Road, Peckham, London

item.title: Leighton Road, both directions, near the Kentish Town end, 3rd August
item.description:
Lots of scree on the sides of the road in both directions. It's adjacent to the new road surfacing that's brown-grey in colour on both sides of the road. Makes it harder for cyclists to stop quickly for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Leighton Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Outside Margaret House on Leighton Road, 3rd August
item.description:
The base of the tree is dense with foliage. From a cyclist's point of view, this fully covers the view of the pavement to see pedestrians about to cross. Dangerous. Been like this for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Leighton Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two shopping trolleys, 3rd August
item.description:
Been there for a couple of weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Rookery Gardens, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public urination, 3rd August
item.description:
Men urinating in dark pathway and plant beds by 45 Holloway road building entrance ( right on the side of Tesco and by Court gardens). Often as groups of guys on night out, creating really unsafe environment to access building after dark. Sometimes even urinating on the building door itself making entering or exiting the building really awful.( See picture )Happening everyday from dusk or even in daytime. Gate or Motion detecting light, or regular patrolling or and signage to deter people required.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Gardens, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite 39 Exeter Road nw2, 3rd August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Exeter Road, London

item.title: Yet More Fly Tipping!, 3rd August
item.description:
This is madness, yet another dump of furniture. Where does it all come from! Please can we have update on conversations with City of London. They must at least pay for all this effort!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wenlock Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Potholes all down Abbotts Walk DA7, 3rd August
item.description:
This road surface is appalling. My parents, both blue badge holders have moved here recently for mobility reasons as they bought a bungalow. My dad also has a pacemaker and he has reported his pacemaker jolting when driving down Abbotts Walk. This road needs resurfacing as soon as possible. The whole road is covered in pot holes and uneven surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbott's Walk, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
